text: Tachibana: What's next?! The 20m shuttle run!
Chibi: Woohooooo! This feels amazing!
You: Why are you so hyped?! No one actually likes the 20m shuttle run!
Tachibana: But let's do the 50m dash first. If we do the shuttle run first, I won't be able to run after that.
Chibi: True. Also, the 50m dash kinda feels like the main event.
You: I get it. Especially in elementary school, if you're fast at 50m, life is easy. You even get popular.
Chibi: Well then, I'll go first.
Chibi: Toh!
6.11 seconds
Tachibana: Well, we knew that would happen.
You: She's 10 and already this fast… she's gonna be a monster in the future.
Tachibana: Honestly, she's already close to athletes. Usain Bolt's 50m split is around 5.47 sec. There's a gap, but she's just 10.
You: For now, Chibi's records are:

You: 50m dash: 6.11 sec,
Side-steps: 79 reps,
Grip strength: 89 kg.
You: That's above high school boys, basically an athlete.
You: Mom's a gorilla, dad's lightning or something?
Chibi: What kind of monster hybrid is that… For the record, I came from the same place as sis.
Tachibana: Yeah… I feel like I left all my physical ability behind in mom's womb.
You: You mean you came out of mom's birth canal…
You: Don't say it like you graduated from the same college or something!
Tachibana: Alright! My turn to run!
Tachibana: Hyaa!
14 seconds
You: As expected. That wasn't a dash, that was just moving.
Chibi: Yup. Compared to me:

Chibi: 50m: 6.11 sec, Grip: 89kg, Side-steps: 79
Sis: 14 sec, 2kg, 7 reps.
Chibi: She's 8 sec slower, 1/44 grip, 1/11 side-steps.
Chibi: That's not just a gap. I could literally crush her with one hand.
You: Are you really sisters? The difference is insane.
Chibi: Sometimes I wonder too. We look similar, and I'm smart too, though not as much as her. But everything else is just on another level.
You: But it's weird… Her form is beautiful. She's just not moving forward at all.
Chibi: Yeah. It feels like time moves differently just around her.
Tachibana: Whew…! Running really feels good!
You: Damn… That pure smile… It's blinding…
You: Well, might as well run too even if it's pointless.
9.99 sec
Chibi: Nice balance, I'd say.
You: Running in 14 sec on purpose is actually harder.
Chibi: By the way, compared to other things… Sis runs 50m in 14 sec = 12.8 km/h.
Tortoise (max): ~0.5 km/h. She beats a turtle at least.
First graders' average: around 11 sec. She loses badly.
Kick scooter: ~15 km/h. She loses.
Slug (figurative): ~0.003 km. She wins.
Old man on a mamachari bike: ~15 km/h. She gets passed easily.
Chibi: Pretty much that. Sis is easily overtaken by an old man's bike, and even elementary kids beat her.
Chibi: Her full-sprint is basically walking speed.
You: At least she's faster than a slug… but slower than any human…
Chibi: She'd probably give up at level 2 of the shuttle run.
You: Huh? What do you mean?

Chibi: Shuttle run = 40m per rep.
Level 1: 18 sec, Level 2: ~16 sec.
She runs 10m in 2.8 sec → 40m = 11.2 sec.
Add 1.5 sec per turn → 12.7 sec.

Chibi: She'd slow 10% on 2nd rep → 12.7 × 1.1 ≈ 14 sec.
So she'd barely make level 2, but fail at level 3 onwards.
Chibi: Plus, she's already tired from the 50m dash. Realistically, she won't make it past level 2.
You: What a gap… She's like a humanoid slug…
Chibi: By the way, I can easily do over 100 reps.
You: You're basically another species…
...Then we did the shuttle run.
As expected, the results.
Tachibana: 14 reps.
Chibi: 111 reps.
I did 50. Didn't feel like holding back.
They watched me as I kept running, and then Tachibana and I watched Chibi as she continued to run alone.
I thought, if the world were to end someday, maybe spending my last moments watching a little girl doing shuttle runs like this wouldn’t be so bad after all.
I felt as if it started to rain. It felt like she was taking all of it upon herself. But it was just my imagination. It wasn’t raining.
Chibi: So, 48.78 cm is the average for the sit-and-reach test, huh?
You: I'm not too confident… desk workers like me struggle.
Tachibana: Well, boys tend to get stiffer than girls. Female hormones (estrogen, relaxin) help keep ligaments flexible, and girls have wider hip sockets so they can open their hips during childbirth.
Tachibana: Exactly, it's to make childbirth possible.
You: I-I see…
(You thinking: She talks about this without any embarrassment… she really sees pregnancy purely as physiology.)
Chibi: Still, I think boys have slightly higher average values at that age. At least for high schoolers. Well, they're still young.
Tachibana: I'm confident!
Chibi: Go for it, sis!
You: You got this! You can do it!
Chibi: Go, go, big sis!!!
You: Don’t lose! Beat your past self! Fear no unknown enemies!
(Tachibana thinking: Why do I get so many cheers when it's my turn…?)
Tachibana: Hmph!
85 cm
Chibi & You: Ehhh?! So flexible! How?!
Tachibana: Yeah… but you get it, right, Chibi…?
Chibi: Ahh, I see…
Chibi: Your ligaments and fascia are too loose, so muscle contraction takes longer. (Can't generate speed)
Chibi: Your joint range of motion is too large, so there's too much 'play' and force doesn't transmit well.
Chibi: You're better at relaxing than generating force. You're good at 'whipping' rather than sudden power.
Chibi: Basically, you can't produce explosive power easily. But your body bends well.
Tachibana: Exactly… having a stiff body isn't always bad. It makes it easier to contract muscles and generate power.
Tachibana: But that's more for athletes or people aiming to improve certain sports. Like MMA or track and field.
You: I see… that’s why your form is so clean. No sticking during joint movement. Even high kicks look smooth.
Chibi: Exactly.
Chibi: Well, guess I'll try too. Hmph!
44 cm
You: Stop pretending to be human! You're a gorilla-light hybrid!
Chibi: Shut up! I'll blow your forehead off with gorilla power and light speed!
Tachibana: Finally, a record that actually looks normal for a girl…
You: Yeah… until now she was basically a monster…
You: Alright, I'll try too! Hmph!
35 cm
You: Well, I don't plan on giving birth, so this is good enough.
Chibi: What kind of excuse is that? Never say that in front of other women, okay?
Tachibana: Well, that's still good for a man in his 20s.
Tachibana: Well, I surpassed that record long ago!
You: Who does she think she is… she's basically a slug when it comes to running.
Chibi: She's clearly getting cocky now that she finally has a record to brag about.
Next up: sit-ups and standing long jump!
